oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Charles Martin Simmons
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A five page letter dated 1918 written on YMCA letterhead stationary from Charles Simmons in Knoxville to his family describing YMCA programs and training activities. He served as wagoner in Truck Co. C, 8th Corps Art. Park. He was from Chester County, Tennessee. In this letter he discusses training on the trucks, "I have been on the road most ever day. Auto riding aint no Pleasure to me now and reparing them aint no Pleasure either " (sic).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
